name: Keong Saik Bakery @ Chip Bee Gardens

reviews.text: Have always loved Keong Saik, and was thrilled to find out they opened a branch near work! Exquistely crafted local flavours so brilliantly combined and created into new things with new textures. I am in awe. So of course i had to bring my young nephews to try. Definitely a place to enjoy from young to old.

V nice cafe. Local and authentic selling also frothed lattes and the likes. Pastries are imaginative and a pretty wide variety. Pricing is also reasonable unlike another chain further down the road. Took a photos of the cakes and not the pastries so take a surprise trip down!

A charming café that blends Western style with local flavors, offering a unique breakfast experience. The rose cheesecake was rich and delicately floral, while the sourdough with curry dip delivered a bold, comforting taste of familiar spices. The latte, made from Singaporean kopi, was smooth, robust, and aromatic. While the curry is pre-portioned from a central kitchen, extra sauce is available for an additional fee. The cozy ambiance adds to the charm, though weekends can get lively with families and kids around. Still, it’s a lovely spot to enjoy a thoughtful fusion of flavors.

Great coffee made by Barrista Kelvin. Food was unique and tasty.

Really nice outlet. Retro feel. Tables wide apart enough for private chats.

Recommended!
The cake was absolutely delicious, and the ambience was great! The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating when we asked to celebrate our friend’s birthday. Highly recommend!
